title: This Jungle is Just BAD!
body:
Ok this is some bull crap right here. There are what? 5 good junglers now? And buffs are too good from dragon and jungle pathing eather A: leaves you open to be counter jungled by not taking buff before your 3rd back. Or B: Die It's so bad Trundle{{champion:48}}  can't even stay in the jungle for more then 3 camps. TRUNDLE{{champion:48}}   with sustain only 2nd to Aatrox{{champion:266}}   and Fiddlesticks{{champion:9}}   . The smite{{summoner:11}}  cool down is way to long and the new hunter's buffs are just bad. The only good ones give smite  a better CD and the one that stuns. (Hell, that might be the same one) Riot don't do this to us.

Riot needs to consult some regular summoners before doing something this big... There's theory and reality, the thing is that if you think something is a good idea, ask the people that are literally making it possible for you to do it

~Edgar A Pwn

replies.body:
I would argue Jungler diversity isn't particularly good on live. What we are trying to do is having multiple axes on which a Jungler can be good so that the same champions don't keep rising to the top. One champ may be better at traditional camp clearing, but another might be better at counter jungling or even farming Feral Flare-style.

In any case, we will have to adjust the tuning on some champs for sure if we go through with these changes. It isn't worth taking those steps until we feel pretty solid about the changes themselves or the target will just be constantly moving. I would focus on your feedback on the system overall and not necessarily which champs have become better or worse at jungling. That information is still important, but it's easier to iterate on than the new jungle design overall.

Try to clear more than 3 camps as Nautilus, Hecarim, or Kha'zix, I dare you (not to be confrontational, but to illustrate my point). Meanwhile Nunu with Blue never dips below 90% health and full mana. Several current Junglers can barely secure their first blue buff before they need to recall, going Boots anywhere near before you get a major damage or tank item and you will pay. Olaf does a good job of his first clear, but once his Blue buff dies let's just say he doesn't have the damage to support his high Q cost. You can go into the AoE smite upgrade, but I don't think you should have to be forced into it just to be able to farm your jungle after 5 minutes.

There is a huge gap between the bad junglers who can jungle well now and the good junglers on PBE.
Having different ways to jungle won't help if Lee Sin is still going to be a god that kills you at your second buff every single game.

> Having different ways to jungle won't help if Lee Sin is still going to be a god that kills you at your second buff every single game.

Got invaded by Lee Sin as jungle {{champion:133}}  and kicked his ass. Felt good.

> I would argue Jungler diversity isn't particularly good on live. What we are trying to do is having multiple axes on which a Jungler can be good so that the same champions don't keep rising to the top. One champ may be better at traditional camp clearing, but another might be better at counter jungling or even farming Feral Flare-style.

Nice on paper. The reality is: if you're in the bronze-gold ditch and gank less than the opposing jungler, you get flamed and reported.

When that happens I get irritated, but I don't flame or report the jungler, I just repeatedly tell them that if we don't get a gank that the lane is going to snowball out of control.  That usually gets a response.

> When that happens I get irritated, but I don't flame or report the jungler, I just repeatedly tell them that if we don't get a gank that the lane is going to snowball out of control.  That usually gets a response.

I really do get tired of some people expecting the jungler to save them from their own bad play.  Not to say there aren't absentee junglers that don't provide much for their team, but when bot lane has already fed the opposing adc 5 kills before their jungler has even reached level 6, only to then blame the jungler for being unable to fix the situation?  Yeah that's annoying.

I'm not saying that the jungler should have to save every lane, but it gets really annoying when you lose a lane because they refuse to gank, and then you or the support get blamed for dying to the enemy jungler's gank.  Junglers gank for a good reason, after all, and ignoring a lane doesn't really help anyone long-term.

> I'm not saying that the jungler should have to save every lane, but it gets really annoying when you lose a lane because they refuse to gank, and then you or the support get blamed for dying to the enemy jungler's gank.  Junglers gank for a good reason, after all, and ignoring a lane doesn't really help anyone long-term.

There are junglers who seem to think their job is to do nothing but farm their own side of the jungle.  Then there are laners who getted owned straight up, or get repeatedly ganked due to overextending and/or not warding, who then rage at their jungler for losing them their lane.  Both are incredibly annoying.  I'll take the farming jungler over the lane feeder/rager any day though.  At least he's not feeding or bitching at his teammates.

The worst thing is when you are jungling and you fall behind somehow (invaded at a buff for example) and need to farm to catch up again and then every lane hates on you for not being everywhere exactly like they want. I had a Wukong game a few days ago and got behind due to an invade, and had to farm. Our trend top kept feeding a teemo, and then our Akali mid (also fed 0 and 4) started flaming me because she kept trying to all in a Zed pre 6 and I wasn't there on time.

This is true, the "blame the jungler" mentality is what threw me to play top or mid instead. I love to jungle, but it us hard to play it the way I like if you are being flamed all the time for not babysitting the lanes. 
But seeing these changes turn on the jungle spark in me again.

It's great that you guys are open to discussion surrounding these upcoming potential changes, but why respond to useless and vitriolic threads like this? Surely there's a more constructive discussion happening elsewhere on the boards.

1) You have no right to say "feral flare style" when you are flat-out deleting Wriggle's Lantern

2) Pretty much ALL the junglers are bad now. Season 4 made the jungle harder (camps are stronger and scale). Season 5 is increasing the difficulty even more.

I was gonna write more, but why bother. Nothing I say will stop you from completely changing my role and my items every single new season. Doesn't matter how great the jungle is one season, gotta COMPLETELY CHANGE it the next season. Spirit stone was amazing this season. It was the best change you've made to the game.... Like ever. NOPE GUT IT.

I agree, it allowed a lot of non-traditional junglers like Wukong and Pantheon to thrive by giving them sustain. It was also fairly balanced (although favoring high early dps champions).

Ghostcrawler, why did you reply to a QQ thread that lacks facts or stats, or even a real suggestion on what could be improved?  I get that it's part of your job to engage the community, but this guy is basically just throwing a tantrum.

> I would argue Jungler diversity isn't particularly good on live.

Huh?  I've been playing since the Riven patch and by my (admittedly anecdotal) reckoning, jungler diversity is better now than almost ever before.  You can't take just anyone into the jungle and compete at Worlds level, no, but there's actually a huge swath of champions that are perfectly viable at most other levels of play.

Juuuuust keep in mind that many of us want tank junglers back.


Remember how Nautilus in that cinematic kicked ass? Would be nice if each swing of his anchor felt that devastating in-game even if you had to reduce his AS. And it would be a glorious day if Skarner or other tanks can make a resurgence too.
But...but muh {{champion:78}} jungle.

> but another might be better at counter jungling or even farming Feral Flare-style.

Except Feral Flare is being removed from Summoners Rift...
As long as Sion will be able to jungle in the new jungle when he's built tank, then I don't mind. Sion MUST be able to jungle or I'll view that new jungle as a failure.
So then just pick Aatrox or Fiddles? You know Riot changes the meta and makes different champions viable in order to keep the game fresh. Move with them or get run over.

> So then just pick Aatrox or Fiddles? You know Riot changes the meta and makes different champions viable in order to keep the game fresh. Move with them or get run over.

killing off the viability of a large roster of junglers doesn't help keep the game fresh

all this does is significantly reduce the number of champions that can function in the jungle

This is also the very first change they've throw out. Instead of spewing all this toxic dribble why not make a constructive post about issues that have been encountered? You're likely to be received better and Riot is more willing to have a discussion about. Sitting here and yelling that Riot's incompetent because the very first test they did isn't 100% perfect is nonsense. No one expected it to be the complete answer off the bat. That's why they test things.

As it is I don't feel there is great jungler variety. Sure, maybe in like bronze it's decent sized, but shrinks immensely the higher you go up.
Yeah, for real tho i was mad.  And you're right they could have. But they didn't they went to someone who was mad and was cool about it.

Have they actually killed off junglers, or have they simply started testing jungle changes with the intent to compensate other junglers after they know how the jungle will work?

> In any case, we will have to adjust the tuning on some champs for sure if we go through with these changes.

I believe this says it all.

The new jungle and jungle items are amazing.  They make you think about which camps to smite how you can conserve your sustain and gives counter play.  There is a somewhat limiting factor on champs who can currently clear but that can always be tweaked later.

On the PBE I have tried Jax, Sion Hecarim, Elise, Nocturne, WW, Diana, Nunu, Udyr, Skarner, Shaco and Nautilus.  Out of all these the only hard clear was Nautilus.  All of these champions had time to clear and time to gank sometimes even keep all mobs down while ganking.  The sustain you get from the new jungler items is a bit lacking but overall the diversity is where it is at.

You can grab warrior enchant for those hard hitting champs like Sion or Hecarim.  You can grab Juggernaut for those who need a bit of health like Skarner.(although I prefer this on SION and Hecarim but I usually play them tank.)  The magus is a bit underwhelming but still gives ap jungles some love.  And finally the Slayer enchant.  This is a perfect item on jax nocturne and WW.  Scaling att spd with on hit damage.  I think I am in love.

The Smite options are also quite refreshing.
Stalkers give poor gankers a nice slow and some true damage.(I think this was made for Shyvana)
Poachers give a reduced CD on smite and increased gold for invaded jungle creeps.(Shaco Nunu Lee Sin all benefit.)
Rangers Trailblazer drastically helps some slower clearers with AOE smite.(Sejuani Naut)
Skirmishers is kinda a gank assist for those who already have sticking potential by giving a bit of damage on attack and vision when used on a player.  (Xin Jarvan nocturne)


All in all I am very pleased with the thought put into this new jungle and with a bit of tweaks to some of the jungles this can be the best jungling season yet.
Yeah once i tried out more of the enchantments i'm happy about them.  (But i am mad about not being able to put red buff on my fizz build D:)

> TRUNDLE{{champion:48}}   with sustain only 2nd to Aatrox{{champion:266}}   and Fiddlesticks{{champion:9}} 
Wut{{champion:19}}

Dude, not only is it the FIRST ITERATION (Read, NONE OF THIS STUFF IS BALANCED AND THEY'RE STILL TRYING THINGS OUT) but from what I've seen so far all the junglers in the game can STILL jungle, but the vast majority of them (Read, those without a STUPID amount of health recovery of some kind) are forced to go back after their first clear. After you get the upgraded Jungle item, the jungle goes back to pretty much what it is on live in terms of letting anyone easily jungle in it. Even currently weak junglers like {{champion:113}}  are able to do it fine after they go back for that upgrade. Hell, old junglers who've been kicked out of the Jungle {{champion:131}} might be able to come BACK to it with these changes. 

Frankly, I kinda LIKE this idea. Not only does it take away from the stupidly strong early game ganking/pressure that's become dominate in the game without outright killing it, it actually GIVES the option of Counter Jungling, cuz that kinda doesn't exist what so ever in the current meta. Heck, Junglers now have a bit more choice in things they want to do now, which is a HUGE upgrade in general. Want to give a jungler with weak ganks  a bit more reliable ganking ability {{champion:102}}? Or how about making one of the best counter Junglers in the game able to do it even MORE and have it actually MATTER {{champion:20}}?

Honestly, I like the ideas that they're trying out, and this is PRESEASON. The things we see here are not 100% guaranteed to make it to live and even if they do, we ALL know for a fact that if Riot see's a problem with a set of changes or something becomes so stupidly dominate that it pushes everything out (I'm looking at you {{champion:64}}) Then they'll take measures to change this. So instead of reflexively fighting back against something, how about you try to learn the new set up BEFORE saying the entire things crap?
And you're right most likely i'm just talking about the here and now.

Here and now means NOTHING when it comes to this or ANY other game that updates on a bi-weekly/monthly basis. Here and now,  {{champion:6}} is considered to be one of the worst champions in the game. Next patch, he could get a buff to make him the most dominate champion in the entire game.

Considering the fact that this is A) Their first iteration of the preseason, B) Is Preseason, so things in general are MEANT to break the game so we can see what works for the system and what doesn't, and C) All the junglers can STILL jungle just fine after getting through their first clear and getting the upgrade for machete means the sky isn't falling and that Riot is trying to make good on their promise allowing different junglers to be used, instead of the super hyper aggressive pro gankers.

I managed to stay rather healthy for nearly as long as i wanted as morgana in the jungle after my first back, so i really have to wonder waht u are doing with Trundle.

The oonlything i agree on is that smite(atleast if u don'T go for the quick-smite option) has to high cd, especially on those that can be used vs champions.
Smite is now a big part og ur jungleclear, and the buffs from big creeps are really great, so puting it on cd for a champion sets u far,far back in terms of jungleing.
even with only jungling, i only had it up ever 3-4camps as morgana(i went for tribalizer, the aoe nuke+stun together with W allows really fast clear).

If u utilize the buffs from smiting, especially gromp(the big wraith on live) or the 2 golems, ur clear will really improve alot.

I think this will let many junglers do better than before.

quite frankly i am worried about nautilus; the ANcient GOlem item was all that made him viable again, and now i have no clue how he's supposed to get his first clear in. Oh well, at least Cho might be good again

The Juggernaut Item plus the splash damage smite will help him quite a bit in his clear speed.
You get CDR MS Health and splash smite damage. You can add whatever tanky item you want on top of it.
I think it could work.

They've said they want to get tanky junglers to be a thing too. Go play the changes and see how they fare. If they're not up to par post a constructive thread about it to give Riot an idea of what's wrong. They can't magically know that something doesn't work without players testing it out.

I dont mind the jungle that much as it is. I do agree having some more diversity would open up things for junglers a little more, but most of the people who complain about jungle dont really play it that often. One thing that would be nice is one more additional jungle camp on double golem side, make make some room down in that huge chunk of trees by the 2nd inner turrets. Also, lots of champs are good in the jungle, it just comes down to timing and understanding where their jungler is as well

i'm sure it will eventually balance itself out, and it's still really early. it's just a little funny that they tried to open up the jungle to more champions last season by making it easier, and now they're making it harder again. I hope that the wrinkles will get ironed out!
